p: Dengue virus (DENV): Flaviviridae is responsible for dengue disease, caused by four distinct serotypes. Currently, it is the predominant arthropod-borne viral disease affecting humans [ 27], with 3.6 billion people living in areas at risk of transmission and hundreds of millions of dengue fever cases reported each year [ 28, 29], causing ongoing epidemics in several countries [ 29, 30] ( https://www.outbreakobservatory.org/outbreak-thursday) ( Table S1; Figure 1)
